1: Of David Be thou my Judge, O LORD, for I walk innocently: my trust is in the LORD, therefore shall I not fall.
2: Examine me, O LORD, and prove me: try out my reins and my heart.
3: For thy loving-kindness is before mine eyes, and I walk in thy truth.
4: I sit not among vain persons, and have no fellowship with the deceitful.
5: I hate the congregation of the wicked, and will not sit among the ungodly.
6: I wash my hands with innocency, O LORD, and so go I to thine altar.
7: That I may shew the voice of thy praise and tell of all thy wonderous works.
8: LORD, I love the habitation of thy house, and the place where thy honour dwelleth.
9: O destroy not my soul with the sinners, nor my life with the bloodthirsty.
10: In whose hands is wickedness, and their right hand is full of gifts.
11: But as for me, I will walk innocently: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.
12: My foot standeth right: I will praise thee (O LORD) in the congregations.
